{"step_by_step_thinking": "The absorption of fluoride in the body happens through the gastrointestinal tract, which includes the stomach and intestines. Document [3] mentions that following the absorption of fluoride from the stomach and intestines, its metabolism is identical to that of water-borne fluoride or other vehicles containing ionized fluoride. Document [5] also mentions that under most conditions, fluoride is rapidly and extensively absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract. Therefore, the absorption of fluoride in a child mainly takes place in the intestine.", "answer_choice": "A"}
